resources.string: Display and plot options and colors controls, workout feedback options.
Various trip and bike related parameters, FTP, max power, global power ranges.
Logging control, power control, plot save size, error reporting.
Autostart control, minimum length, lap control.
Colors used for display and plot items.
Heart rate ranges used for intensity time tracking.
Power ranges used for intensity time tracking.
Controls the alpha of the speed display when on top. Lower to make the underlying buttons more visible. Current: %s%%
Heart rate line. Average, current and max.
Power line. Average, current and max.
Cadence line. Average, current and max.
Real time, pedaling %, max speed, active time line enable
Distance, real speed, active speed, average incline line enable
Ascent, rate of climb, altitude, incline and descent line enable
Enable text to speech based notifications
Prefix used for all logging files.\n
Number appended to file prefix to make logging file names. Auto increments on new ride.\n
Keeps the sensors active in AirPlane mode. Start sensors then enter AirPlane mode to save the cell power. Sorry not working on later versions of Android 4.3+
Enable the map view, hence the power consuming data downloads for it.
Enable use of alternative and regional map tile source.
Select heart rate style: percentage of set max or real. Used for current and average displays\n
FTP optionally used for workout target power definition as a %% of this.\nCurrent: %s
The distance in meters you need to move before a new trip is automatically started. Use 0 for off.\n
Time in minutes since last active before automatically stopping a trip when resuming.\n
The minimum trip distance to keep the trip record. (miles or km)\n
The time in seconds without a speed or peddle event after which the speed or cadence are zeroed.\n
The time you need to be stationary for the auto lap system to start a new lap. (0 for off.)\n
Time in seconds used for moving averages of power, cadence, speed and heart rate.\nCurrent: %s
Display text is a single colors else text match plot colors.
Text color when not matched to plot colors.
Where you configure accounts for sites, some site specific options.
Map settings. (Double tap the map for in use menu)
Color of this ride\'s track on map (has alpha).
Width of this ride\'s track on map.\nCurrent: %s
Color of the loaded route to follow on the map (has alpha).
Width of the loaded route to follow on the map.\nCurrent: %s
Basic usage stats are gathered on how you are using the application to help improve it.
Disable hints, reset all settings, etc.
Enable vibration feedback on soft button presses.
Resets all settings to their default values.
Lets you restore the main database from a previously saves version.
Screen brightness - dimming - lock-screen options. The setting is for while riding.\n
Which lap mode to use. Going to auto-position sets position to current position.\n
Select axis for item or off.\n
Control over the various feedback options.
How long between feedback events about the workout target.\nCurrent: %s
Enable text to speech based target feedback.\n
Enable audible beep based target feedback.\n
Enable audible beep based duration feedback.\n
The sensor returned the following response to the calibration:\n%s
Calibration failed with the following error code:\n%s
No bikes. You need to add a bike.
No rides. Get on your bike!
GPS only - no bike sensors.\nHR works either way.

The main sensor display area overlays the control buttons to save screen space but the buttons are still visible and usable underneath. If you want the buttons separate stop trip, stop sensors then swipe down and uncheck Overlay controls and main sensor display.
Are you sure you want to? This can not be undone!
Reset max? This can not be undone!
Do you have an internet connection?
No need to associate sensor type.
Sensor manager needs to be installed.
Exernal Storage not available. Can not access plot, route or workout data. Using default screen layouts. IpBike may be very unstable.
There is a problem. Collecting crash report data!
Unexpected error. Please send a report.
Please click here to help fix the issue.
Sorry something went wrong. Please help me fix this by sending me error data, all you have to do is click \'OK\' and have data access enabled.
You can add your comments about the problem below:
Controls error reporting and usage stats options.
Syslog enabled, may contain personal info but good for debugging.
So I can contact you for more information to help find the problem if it is not obvious.
No compatible sensor manager is available.
There is a new version of IpSensorMan. Please update for full functionality.
IpBike is limited to 1,000,000 wheel revs. Current wheel revolutions: %d. To unlock this limitation
please download %s from the iforpowell.com website.
please download %s from Google Play or the iforpowell.com website.
Sorry %s is not available at present.

string-array.name: main_hints
string-array.item: Menu - More - Hints to bring the hints back up. There are different hints for each section of the app.
Menu - More - Help to go to the online users guide. It may be worth looking to see what the options are.
Settings - Support options for a list of support options and other useful links.
Swipe left and right to change screens. Swipe down to customize the overall screen setup and modify screen order.
Long press an item to get the edit options for it and to add and delete items.
Groups of lines can be in expanded or contracted mode touch an item to toggle this.
You can change from the map to a the real time graph or the workout controls at the bottom of the screen: Double tap map for the menu to switch.
Long touch on real time graph for it\'s menu options to get back to the map or workout controls.
Long touch on workout controls for it\'s menu options to get back to the map or real time graph.
Touch below speed to toggle speed or buttons on top when riding. The menu button also brings the buttons to the front.
For normal riding Start sensors/GPS optionally select a bike, wait for the GPS to fix then Start trip. When done Stop trip then Stop sensors/GPS.
Long touch altitude to get to calibration screen with pressure sensor equipped phones.
Long touch any power item for option to initiate power calibration.
Rides less than the minimum distance or minimum time set from Settings - Main bike settings - Trip control, are not logged.
Check the Settings to see what options you have.
Once trip active use start workout to start a workout, stop workout to finish it early, pause workout to pause it.
workout step is used to move manually to the next workout step, e.g. for an open duration step.
Continuous audio feedback is controlled from the Settings - Audio-visual settings - TTS. Speech feedback enable to switch it on.

string-array.name: bikes_hints
string-array.item: Touch bike to go to bike editor.
Long touch bike for delete option.
Long touch sensor to delete association with bike.
Select GPS only if no sensors on bike.
A bike with no sensors will have sensors found on the next start sensors automatically associated with it.

string-array.name: route_hints
string-array.item: Double tap map for data source options.
Load route will load a .gpx, .kml or .fit based route to follow.
Save as saves an optimized route file for easy reuse later.
To precache a route zoom to the desired level and press follow.
Precached routes can be followed with the data connection disabled when riding.

string-array.name: ride_list_hints
string-array.item: Totals Tab has per bike stats. All rides tab has a list of all rides. Selected tab has rides as per the settings in the Selection tab.
Long touch in All rides tab for delete or merge with next ride options.
Long touch in Totals to clear selected totals.
Touch for a ride to view details.
Selection tab has sort order choice for all other tabs.
Touch colored max lines in ride view to reset max values.
When viewing a ride you can swipe left and right to go to the previous and next rides.

string-array.name: plot_hints
string-array.item: Plot has multi-touch pinch controls on compatible phones.
Single touch left - right for pan. up - zoom in, down - zoom out.
Laps allows showing specific laps one by one.
Axis allows selecting what to plot and on which axis.
Send will allow sharing of a higher resolution version of the plot.
When sharing a plot the ride description can be pasted use a long touch in the text entry area then paste.

string-array.name: ride_hints
string-array.item: You can rename the ride and add a description.
Send allows sending of text description or file of ride to other compatible applications.
When sending a file the text description is available to paste by long pressing in text entry area.
Save as to save the ride file in the selected formats to the chosen directory.
Upload targets need configuring in Settings - Other phone settings - Upload settings

string-array.name: workout_hints
string-array.item: Workouts consist of workout steps and repeat steps.
Steps can be active, rest, warm up or cool down.
Step duration can be simple time or distance based, or based off HR or power.
Steps can have target intensities based off HR, cadence, speed or power
Repeat steps repeat a sequence of workout steps.
Repeat steps can just be a simple count or based off distance, time, HR or power.
There are a number of sample workouts shipped with the app, use Load to see them.
Workouts are saved in .fit format and should be importable from other compatible software.
Touch a step to edit it.
Long press a step to delete or insert before it or select it as the first step of a repeat sequence.
When adding a repeat step you first select where it repeats from.
Use the Open duration to have a manually set duration during the workout. You move the workout on manually with the Workout step button.
Use the Open target if you do not want target information during the step e.g. for simple max effort or recovery steps.
Settings - Audio-visual settings - Workout - Options to configure feedback options during a workout.

resources.string: Authorize access to your RunKeeper account.
The name for the new OpenFitApi based fitness site.
Delete %1$s from the list of upload targets.
Screen brightness - orientation - size, Speed overlay Alpha, Haptic feedback.
control over showing labels and units and their color.
Show unit labels for display items
Either enable the GPS system setting or disable the use of GPS in IpBike.
If you intend to take out a RunKeeper Elite subscription using this link gives me a percentage of the income. You are thus also supporting IpBike.
Time between Live updates. Affects battery usage.\n
Live update on, off or ask for each activity.\n
Enable auto pause detection on RunKeeper uploads.\n
Talk the step summary as the step starts.
Various places to go for support. I want to help if you are having trouble.
Various pages with information on using IpBike.
Forum at iforpowell.com, check the questions out. Feel free to register and post.
IpBike Facebook page. Feel free to like and give constructive feedback.
Something broken? Please let me know so I can fix it. Want a feature? Why not ask?
Timed out waiting for Strava to process. Check with Strave in a while.
Don\'t do upload target selection every upload.

Trim route, normally you want \'Do db trim\' which updates the trip, bike and all records removing the trimed distance etc. as well as trimming the log file.\nThere may be cases where you just want to trim the log file in which case use \'no db trim\'
Set the distance in your selected units.
Default intensity given no HR data.\n
Web page for the IpBike Strava club.
Interval between speech feedback in seconds. Use a decimal value to specify a distance.\n
Use a date-time stamp for the extension of the logfile name.
Overlay controls and main sensor display
Sensor display and buttons on left not top
Add new screen default or load from previous file.
Delete screen from swipeable list. Permanent means you can not load it back up again.
Instantaneous speed or pace from sensor or GPS.
Overall active (not including stops) moving speed or pace over the selected interval.
Overall real (including stops) moving speed or pace over the selected interval.
Overall distance. As measured from the speed sensor or GPS over the selected interval.
Maximum recorded speed over the selected interval. There is some spike filtering.
Percentage of time pedaling over the selected interval.
Average cadence over the selected interval.
Recent average cadence. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
Max cadence over the selected interval. There is some spike filtering.
Pedal revolutions over the selected interval.
Pedaling time over the selected interval.
Coasting time over the selected interval.
Average heart rate over the selected interval.
Recent average heart rate. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
Max heart rate over the selected interval.
Heart rate beats over the selected interval.
Time when you are moving e.g. stops removed. Over the selected interval.
Total time e.g. stops included. Over the selected interval.
Time of day hours minutes and seconds.
Time of day hours and minutes.
Either from the GPS or pressure sensor based where available.
Total ascent over the selected interval. Accurate when pressure based.
Total descent over the selected interval. Accurate when pressure based.
Recent incline. Only accurate with pressure based altitude and sensor based distance.
Total average gradient over the selected interval. This is (ascent + descent) / distance
Recent climb rate. Only accurate with pressure based altitude.
Average power (while pedaling) over the selected interval.
Recent average power. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
Max power over the selected interval. There is some spike filtering.
Energy in kilojoules over the selected interval. This is accumulated from the power meter sensor.
Vertical distance being used for incline and climb rate calculation.
Horizontal distance being used for incline calculation.
Time being used for climb rate calculation.
Speed over the period used to calculate incline.
Recent altitude readings max - min. Used to provide hysteresis for pressure based altitude.
wheel revolutions based off the current bike wheel size.
Global wheel revolutions. This is the 1,000,000 rev limit you can unlock with IpBikeKey. Based off a nominal 2070 mm wheel.
30s power that feeds into normalized power figure.
5s power that feeds into workout system.
Normalized power. Using the standard Coggan algorithm.
Intensity factor. NP/FTP (as set in setting.)
Training stress score. Using the standard Coggan algorithm.
Power Balance. Left right balance although the exact meaning depends on your power meter.
Average power balance. Left right balance although the exact meaning depends on your power meter.
Temperature. Current temperature from external ANT+ sensor or phone sensor if available.
Average Temperature. Average temperature over the ride.
Minimum temperature. Minimum temperature over the ride.
Maximum temperature. Maximum temperature over the ride.
Change FTP setting. You may want to update the default in Settings - Main bike settings - Functional threshold power
Select file to use with the MapsForge map source.\n
Get the temperature from the phone battery if available. You really need to work out the correct calibration value for your phone.
Calibration value to use when using the phone battery to get the temperature. Should probably be a negative number.\nCurrent: %s
Key override options. The order of checking is as listed. If a function is not possible then the search carries on so you can use the same button more than once.
Volume up and down overrides. Default will control in app volume.\n
Maximum temperature over the last 24 hours for sensor.
Minimum temperature over the last 24 hours for sensor.
Raw altitude from pressure sensor or GPS before filtering.
Time in seconds to filter altitude for min max variation.\nCurrent: %s
Records to average slope and incline readings over.\nCurrent: %s
Google Maps not available on this device.
Show map scale bar. Sorry not available on Google Maps.
Offset all altitude data manually by a fixed amount or using an online look-up for the start and end locations.
Amount to offset the altitude values by. Can be negative in whole units.
Left Torque Effectiveness. (Only some power meters)
Right Torque Effectiveness. (Only some power meters)
Combined pedal smoothness. (Only some power meters)
Left pedal smoothness. (Only some power meters)
Right pedal smoothness. (Only some power meters)
Average Left Torque Effectiveness. (Only some power meters)
Average Right Torque Effectiveness. (Only some power meters)
Average Combined pedal smoothness. (Only some power meters)
Average Left pedal smoothness. (Only some power meters)
Average Right pedal smoothness. (Only some power meters)
Reset max or all average type stats? This can not be undone!
Name to use for custom map source.\nCurrent %s
Base address for accessing tiles e.g. "http://tiles.prahounakole.cz/"\nCurrent %s
Select file to use with the MapsForge rendering theme. It will be a .xml file
Use the default MapsForge rendering theme.
Enable Proximity sensor to brighten or wake up screen.
Weight of rider (kg), used for virtual power and calories calculations.\nCurrent :%s
Custom label or empty for default
On flat level ground with no wind press start then accelerate to a fast speed and then start coasting. Coast till a slow speed then press stop.
You normally want this enabled unless your getting strange results e.g. carrying the phone in a sealed bag.
Time of day hours minutes and seconds. 24 hour clock.
Time of day hours and minutes. 24 hour clock.
Sorry calibration for virtual power not available yet.

This calibration. Rolling %1$.5f Drag %2$.4f Quality %3$.0f.
Combined calibration Rolling %4$.5f Drag %5$.4f.
Selecting current removes all old calibration files.
Selecting combined adds the current file to the combined calibration files.
Weight of rider (lb), used for virtual power and calories calculations.\nCurrent :%s

Select what to send, then the app to send it to.
 Upload .tcx to RideWithGps with upload@rwgps.com
 Upload .tcx to MapMyTracks with custom email address
 Give a name and press save to have this action appear on the uploads target list in the future.
Authorize access to your Strava account.
Re-calculate stats off GPS e.g. in case of bad speed sensor data? This can not be undone!
Use Cross icon rather then IpBike icon.

You look to have a phone capable of supporting Bluetooth low energy.\n I have a beta version of IpSensorMan the companion app for IpBike that enables support for Bluetooth Low energy sensors. If you have a sensor and want to give it a go please visit\n http://www.iforpowell.com/cms/index.php?page=btle-beta
Used to disable feedback when stopped e.g. at the lights.
Speak all stats each time not one per time interval.
Interval climb rate. Rate of ascent or descent for the current timeframe interval.
Bearing as reported by the GPS so you need to be moving to get a good value.
Time map stays unlocked for after each touch event.\n%s
Stops Strava performing altitude correction on the data uploaded. As a side effect the data is uploaded as .tcx rather than .fit.
Distance in meters used for moving averages of power, cadence, speed and heart rate.\nCurrent: %s
Recent average speed. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
Recent distance average speed. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average distance.
Recent distance average heart rate. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average distance.
Recent distance average cadence. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average distance.
Recent distance average power. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average distance.
Hemoglobin concentration from muscle oxygen sensor.
Saturated hemoglobin percentage from muscle oxygen sensor.
Average hemoglobin concentration for the current timeframe interval.
Average saturated hemoglobin percentage for the current timeframe interval.
Max hemoglobin concentration for the current timeframe interval.
Min hemoglobin concentration for the current timeframe interval.
Max saturated hemoglobin percentage for the current timeframe interval.
Min saturated hemoglobin percentage for the current timeframe interval.
Recent time average hemoglobin concentration. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
Recent time average saturated hemoglobin percentage
Recent time average saturated hemoglobin percentage. See Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
How hard you have to tap to trigger the tap detector. \nCurrent: %s
Tap the device relatively hard within 5 seconds to unlock screen.
Reset min and max or all average type stats? This can not be undone!
Full screen mode hides notification bar.
Press the key you want to use in the style you want to use.\nPress, Long Press or Double Press
Start Sensors (gps) - Stop Sensors - Pause trip - Resume Trip hardware control key.\n
Start Trip - Stop Trip hardware control key.\n
Workout Start - Workout Stop hardware control key.\n
Workout Pause - Workout Resume hardware control key.\n
Enable TTS and display feedback on max events.
Scaling for text rendering in Mapsforge maps. 10 for default.
Enable adding bike information to .fit export. Some reading software has trouble with this so not on by default.
Each percent of positive slope adjusts grade adjusted pace up by this percentage.\nCurrent: %s
Each percent of negative slope adjusts grade adjusted pace up by this percentage.\nCurrent: %s
Scaling parameters for Grade Adjusted pace battery based temperature etc.
Grade adjusted pace (or speed) see Settings -> Main bike settings -> Scaling parameters for customising.
short form version of distance max 4 characters.
Authorize access to your SportTracks.mobi account.
Recent heart rate variance. See Settings - Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time.
Distance average heart rate variance. See Settings - Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average distance.
Pressure as read by pressure sensor.
Main riding screen orientation selection. Auto locks after start trip.
Set a pause time in tenths of a second before all TTS playback. Helps with some bluetooth headsets.
Enable FIT file to contain Heart rate RR data for HRV analysis.
Gearing or stride length. Based off current speed and cadence.
Sample ride. Just part of a ride to give you some data to experiment with. You should be able to view the plot and the route.
Number of satellites used for last gps fix. Not all devices support this.
Raw gps speed before any filtering is applied.
Empty item you can use as a separator.
Average gearing / stride length. Calculated as total distance (including coasting) / pedal revs or foot falls over the period.
Distance covered per heart rate beat. Calculated off current sensor readings.
Average distance covered per heart rate beat. Calculated off total distance and total hr beats over the period.
Re-calculate summary stats off recorded data. This can not be undone!
Positive recent climb rate. As climb rate but no negative numbers displayed.
Enable overriding of the system set language. Not all translations are complete. email support@iforpowell.com to help.\nCurrent: %s
Moving time based average power e.g. includes coasting.
Settings for uploading to Velo Hero.
Used to login to Velo Hero.\n
Allows over-riding of the Osmdroid cache directory.
Set the pressure sensor sampling rate. Reduce in the case of audio trouble.\n
Enable alternate Fit style for upload, may or may not be better.
Enable alternate Fit style for upload, may or may not be better.
Gender is used in calories from HR algorithm.
Used in calories from HR algorithm.
Used in calories from HR algorithm.\n%s
Heart rate based calories algorithm is preferred over power or speed and distance based methods.
Energy per distance unit in Watt Hours.
Allows insecure uploads. Assume someone will intercept your data!
Time in minutes for which you need to be inactive before automatic stop. Use 0 for off. Also stops sensors.\n
Settings for uploading to Google Fit.
Authorize access to your Google Fit account.
Upload all the sample by sample data.
root mean squared of the squares of the successive differences in N-N intervals (or beat-to-beat intervals). See Settings - Main bike settings - Trip control - Moving average time, for timeframe.
Total time based average power e.g. includes stopped time.
Direction in terms of cardinal points N, NNE, NE, ENE, E etc.
Announce total time along with next step details. Designed for use when giving time feedback for score events.
Total time receiving none 0 power data.
Total time receiving Heart Rate data.
Active time as a % of total time.
What time to use for the average power in uploads.\n
Float version of current HR zone
Average HR zone for the period as a float
Float version of current 5 Second average Power zone
Average power zone for the period as a float
Power per kg using current 5 second power
Power per kg using current 30 second power
While stopping altitude correction upload as .gpx so you get temperature but loose power, laps and indoors speed.
Manual bike selection. You have to manually select the bike each ride. You should not really need this normally.
Uploaded activities are marked as private.
Enable extended lap summary with averages.
Heart rate %s bpm is over max.
Enable Warning when Heart rate is over set max heart rate.
Time between max heart rate warnings.\n
Vibrate on max heart rate warning.
Talk on max heart rate warning.
Beep on max heart rate warning.
Searching for Sensors for non gps only bike.
Offset applied to all raw altitude data. Useful for gps based altitude if you are in an area with a fairly big static offset.\nCurrent %s
Save lap end points as waypoint in the .gpx save.
Force the need to confirm ride deletions.
Used for the GOVSS style running power.
120 seconds moving average speed, used for GOVSS.
120 seconds moving average slope, used for GOVSS.
Maximum gps accuracy needed to start feeding distance to the auto-start system.\n
Used for the GOVSS you can use the RacePace power option to set this.\n
Given time and distance calculates power. Use with 10km - 1 hour type data off a flat course to get a run threshold power setting.
Enter time (m:s) and distance (in selected units) to calculate racepace power\nUse with 10km to 1 hour type data off a flat course to get a run threshold power estimate.
Lactate Normalized power. Using the standard Skiba Govss algorithm.
Lactate intensity factor. LNP/running threshold power (as set in setting.)
Gravity Ordered Velocity Stress Score. Using the standard Skiba algorithm.
Change LTP setting. You may want to update the default in Settings - Personal settings - Run lactate threshold power
Use 120 second averages to feed normalised power for Govss.\n Enable for the standard usage as specified by Skiba algorithm.
Disable all text overlays, e.g. lap summaries etc.
GOVSS power from the 120s average speed and slope numbers.
30s moving average of GOVSS power from the 120s average speed and slope numbers.
Max power, used to define float power zone representation in max zone.\n
Logs details of Virtual power algorithm to file in IpBike /temp area.
Enable TTS feedback when you move from one HR zone to another.
2 decimal places float version of current power zone
Remote button assignment. The order of checking is as listed. If a function is not possible then the search carries on so you can use the same button more than once.
Press the key you want to use on the remote
You need to add the remote to IpSensorMan manually first.
Incline above or below which you are considered to be climbing or decending.\n
Number of times coasting was detected.
Average gearing while pedaling. Calculated as total pedaling distance / pedal revs over the period.
Time spent ascending. Flat defined by Settings -> Main Bike settings -> Trip control -> Max \'Flat\' incline
Time spent descending. Flat defined by Settings -> Main Bike settings -> Trip control -> Max \'Flat\' incline
Time spent on the flat. Flat defined by Settings -> Main Bike settings -> Trip control -> Max \'Flat\' incline
Average time of each coasting event.
Average time of each pelaling event.
Average distance of each coasting event.
Average distance of each pedaling event.
Average time of each moving event.
Average time of each stopped event.
Average distance of each moving event.
Text to Speech feedback and control.
Enable detailed debug logging of heart rate data
Enable detailed debug logging of GPS data
Set suspension mode for fork and shock.
Fork damping and auto mode indication.
Shock damping and auto mode indication.
Cadence ranges used for intensity time tracking.
Speed ranges used for intensity time tracking.
front gear teeth. Can be set per bike as well as globaly.
rear gear teeth. Can be set per bike as well as globaly.
Gearing range: cm or inches based off speed and distance units.
Light1 intensity range used for intensity time tracking.
Light2 intensity range used for intensity time tracking.
Fork damping range used for time tracking.
Shock damping range used for time tracking.
Incline range used for intensity time tracking.
Total number of front gear shifts, two cogs at once counts as 2.
Average time in each front gear.
Average distance in each front gear.
Average front gear teeth, based off active time.
Total number of rear gear shifts, two cogs at once counts as 2.
Average time in each rear gear.
Average distance in each rear gear.
Average rear gear teeth, based off active time.
number of invalid inbound front shifts.
number of invalid outbound front shifts.
number of invalid inbound rear shifts.
number of invalid outbound rear shifts.
Decimal version of latest estimated rear teeth.
Enable detailed debug logging of estimated gear data
Time spent in %s (long press to set which zone)
Distance spent in %s (long press to set which zone)
Speed spent in %s (long press to set which zone)
Authorize access to your TodaysPlan account.
Start messages and time interval style messages.\n
Message announced on going start sensors. Leave empty to disable.\n
Message announced on going start trip. Leave empty to disable.\n
Message to be used with timer %s.\n
Time interval for message %s messages. Use hh:mm:ss format.\n
Name of the current workout step.
Intensity of the current workout step.
Description of the duration of the current workout step.
target type for the current workout step.
target minimum value for the current workout step.
target maximum value for the current workout step.
Duration progress value for the current workout step.
Current target value for the current workout step.
Enable the short version of the end step countdown feedback.\n
Critical power in Watts used in W\'balance calculations.\n
Anaerobic work capacity W\' in Joules used for W\'balance calculations.\n
Rate of change of W\'balance J/s.
5 second rate of change of W\'balance J/s.
Time till W\'balance depletion based off 5s Average adjustment rate.
W\'balance as percentage of total avalaible.
W\'balance depletion as percentage of total avalaible.
Wind speed, (Ground speed - air speed), negative for headwind.
Moving average wind speed, (5s ground speed - 5s air speed)
Average wind speed, negative is headwind.
Time air speed was recorded over
Average W\' balance for the period.
Minimum W\' balance for the period.
Air speed ranges used for intensity time tracking.
Wind speed ranges used for intensity time tracking.
W\'balance depletion ranges used for intensity time tracking.
Gear ranges used for intensity time tracking.
Auto lap will insert lap as you stop and as you start, otherwise stoping only.
Gps fix lost trying to reacquire.
Screen wake up on lap if power mode screen lock disable.
No sensors support from IpSensorMan so no ANT+ or Bluetooth support.
Select Power style: percentage of set Ftp, Critical power or real Watts.\n
Effective force (Newtons) applied to the pedals. Based off current power and cadence. Real force will be higher.
Recent average pedal force in Newtons. Based off recent power and cadence.
Average pedal force in Newtons. Based off average power (while pedaling) and average cadence.
Use brightness when dark (needs gps signal) go to main screen to trigger.
Authorize access to your TrainingPeaks account.
Units are inline with data and take up display space.
Use .PWX not .FIT for upload. Adds lap names but has less advanced data types.
Take screenshot on each lap event.\n
Days before deleting screenshots. (0 for off)\n
Authorize access to your StriveMax account.
Continuous TTS feedback continuous by a screen setup.
Select the screen file to use for TTS feedback control.
100 for a plot point per pixel in time mode. 50 for 2 pixels per point. Lower will be more power efficient and easier to see on very high resolution screens.\n
Size of text used for range labels and legend.\n
Widths of the lines on the plot for each item.\n
Time in tenths of a second between line flips in a compacted group.\n
Distance between TTS feedback events in meters.\n
Save settings to a file that can be restored later. Note passwords and upload authorisations are not saved.
Can not open website. No browser.
Lets you save the database file to restore later. Restore requires IpBikeKey.
Enter your note as the custom lable. Long press -> Appearance -> Custom Lable
Volume setting for when Active between start sensors and stop sensors. Leave as -1 to not have it changed by IpBike.
Time between live updates. Affects battery and data allowance usage.\n
Live update on, off or ask for each activity.\n
Indication of the amount of data uploaded. This will be well less than reality as it\'s just the real data not any overhead.
Last upload time in milliseconds. An indication of connection quality.
Average upload time in milliseconds. An indication of connection quality.
Livetracking enabled but gsm data not enabled and not Indoors / Stationary bike.
Enable logging of 5s power moving average internals. Files will be in /temp/power_5s_*.csv
Number of threats being reported by radar.
Distance of nearest threat being reported by radar.
Speed of nearest threat being reported by radar.
Percentage of time with at least 1 threat.
Average number of threats when there are threats.
Open website so you can register or adjust your settings there.
Map auto zooms in and out based off speed.
Settings for uploading to custom livetracking
server name or ip address for livetracking server\n
Used to login to custom livetracking.\n
Not normally needed but allows you to add parameters to the server url request.\nCurrent %s
Real speed of nearest threat being reported by radar. Your speed + threat speed.
Closing time of nearest threat being reported by radar.
Closing time of threat at which to issue warning.\n
Message to use when there is a radar threat.\n
